results.title: Chase that dream
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Tom Manefield, Australia. Dept. of Housing and Construction and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties faced by low income earners in trying to save money to buy their own home or even rent decent premises. Emphasises how important housing is in people’s lives and how a decision taken at one stage affects their ability to get suitable housing later. Cast includes Laurel McGowan, Peter Fisher, Harry Lawrence, Alan Penney, May Howlett, Gary Files. Credits also include camera; Dean Semler and music; John Gillard.

results.title: The Change at Groote
results.creator_credit: Stefan Sargent, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to show how the aboriginal people of Groote Eylandt in the Gulf of Carpentaria are adjusting to the new life brought about by the discovery on their lands of vast manganese deposits which are now being mined by Broken Hill Proprietary. Made as a fragmented collage of images and sounds, it is intended to produce a direct emotional response, and suggest the confused values of the aboriginals undergoing a social and cultural revolution.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stefan Sargent, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Challenge
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Frank Killian and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: This is a tribute to the Australians who sailed Gretel” in the America’s Cup…” Traces the construction of the Australian challenger, “Gretel”, its trials in America, and finally its efforts in the America’s Cup yacht races.

results.title: Cave temples of India
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A vivid reminder of a great past when people created miracles in stone to express devotion to their gods. Shows some of the famous rock-cut shrines, including the caves at Badami, Elephanta and Ellora, dating from the 17th century. Explains the statues depicting the various incarnations of the Hindu deity. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.

results.title: The Cave: a parable told by Orson Welles
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: An animated dramatization based on “The Allegory of the Cave” from Book 7 of Plato’s “Republic” illustrating mankind’s escape from the world of illusion to the world of reality. Four men chained in a cave take images reflected on a wall for the truth. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films

results.title: Caulfield: a Living City
results.creator_credit: John Freney-Mills, Ewart Wade, Caulfield City Council and Caulfield Film Society
results.brief_description:
Weekend activities in the City of Caulfield. Schools, churches, sporting and social service groups keep the city alive at weekends. Activities include the running of the Caulfield Cup, and quieter games such as tennis and bowls. School children learn road safety at special classes and attend the Youth Centre. For the elderly citizens there are “meals-on-wheels”.

(11/2/19 CC) Selected highlights list from MP:
00:00:02:00 Title card with Caulfield Town Hall in background
00:00:32:00 Caulfield train station

00:06:12:00 15th Caulfield Somers Country scouts packing glass bottles into a 1950’s Holden Ute

00:07:02:00 City of Caulfield Memorial Youth Centre with basketball being played and wrestling with up and coming star Don Fitzpatrick
00:08:00:00 Women sewing at the Caulfield Memorial Youth Centre
00:08:38:00 Curraweena homes near Caulfield community hall

00:12:24:00 what appears to be St Aloysius Church with spire
00:12:44:00 Caulfield Park Conservatory and gardens

00:14:52:00 shot of Caulfield Technical College now Monash University (Caulfield campus) and students entering the front stair case

00:15:30:00 Caulfield South Pre-school

00:18:27:00 Caulfield Town Hall inside and outside

results.title: The Cattle story
results.brief_description: Classroom film on the Northern Australian export beef industry. Historical survey shows introduction of beef cattle to Australia by Governor Phillip. Gives detailed account of beef-raising areas, stock routes and mustering procedures, and indicates importance of the industry in Australia’s economy. Adoption of modern transport methods, in particular, has done much to raise the quality of Australian beef. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Case for books
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, Henry Lewes, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Library services in Australia. Shows briefly some of the work of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Library, the National Library with its varied resources, and examples of State, University, special and public services suggesting their value in meeting needs for information at all levels.

results.title: Careering into marriage
results.creator_credit: Susan Doring, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Stresses the importance of career planning for girls, even though they may marry and leave work permanently or have a broken career. Many women become the breadwinners of their family, and others manage to successfully combine career and family.

results.title: The Car Stealers
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Geoffrey Thompson, Council of Fire and Accident Underwriters and Cine Services
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the problem of car theft and joy-riding by young teenagers in Australia. Points out to car owners and parents how their carelessness can be partly responsible. Shows safety devices and security checks for car-owners. Made with the co-operation of the Victorian Police.
